DataElement.preferredName: Inherited Bone Marrow Failure Syndrome Classification Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A description of the inherited bone marrow failure syndrome classification.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Inherited Bone Marrow Failure Syndrome Classification
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A group of inherited genetic hematopoietic stem cell disorders characterized by bone marrow failure that involves one or more cell lines. Representative examples include Fanconi anemia, Diamond-Blackfan anemia, and Shwachman-Diamond syndrome._A method of generalization, the systematic arrangement of entities into classes or groups based on mutual similarity and certain differing characteristics.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A group of inherited genetic hematopoietic stem cell disorders characterized by bone marrow failure that involves one or more cell lines. Representative examples include Fanconi anemia, Diamond-Blackfan anemia, and Shwachman-Diamond syndrome.

Concepts.definition: A group of inherited genetic hematopoietic stem cell disorders characterized by bone marrow failure that involves one or more cell lines. Representative examples include Fanconi anemia, Diamond-Blackfan anemia, and Shwachman-Diamond syndrome.

Property.preferredDefinition: Classification; the grouping of things into classes or categories.

Concepts.definition: A method of generalization, the systematic arrangement of entities into classes or groups based on mutual similarity and certain differing characteristics.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

ValueDomain.preferredName: Inherited Bone Marrow Failure Syndrome Type
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A group of inherited genetic hematopoietic stem cell disorders characterized by bone marrow failure that involves one or more cell lines. Representative examples include Fanconi anemia, Diamond-Blackfan anemia, and Shwachman-Diamond syndrome._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A rare, autosomal recessive disorder characterized by exocrine pancreas insufficiency, skeletal abnormalities, bone marrow dysfunction, and an increased incidence of leukemia.

Concepts.definition: A rare, autosomal recessive disorder characterized by exocrine pancreas insufficiency, skeletal abnormalities, bone marrow dysfunction, and an increased incidence of leukemia.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A rare inherited disorder in which the bone marrow does not make blood cells. It is usually diagnosed in children between 2 and 15 years old. Symptoms include frequent infections, easy bleeding, and extreme tiredness. People with Fanconi anemia may have a small skeleton and brown spots on the skin. They also have an increased risk of developing certain types of cancer.

Concepts.definition: An autosomal recessive genetic disorder characterized by bone marrow failure, skeletal abnormalities, and an increased incidence of the development of neoplasias.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A rare genetic disorder characterized by nail dystrophy, reticulated skin pigmentation especially on the neck and chest, and oral leukoplakia.  In about half the cases mutations in the TERT, TERC, DKC1, or TINF2 genes are identified.  Patients are at an increased risk of developing bone marrow failure, myelodysplastic syndrome, leukemia, or cancer, especially in the head and neck region.

Concepts.definition: A rare genetic disorder characterized by nail dystrophy, reticulated skin pigmentation especially on the neck and chest, and oral leukoplakia.  In about half the cases mutations in the TERT, TERC, DKC1, or TINF2 genes are identified.  Patients are at an increased risk of developing bone marrow failure, myelodysplastic syndrome, leukemia, or cancer, especially in the head and neck region.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An inherited condition characterized by aplasia of the erythroid series only. The white cells and platelets are not affected. Patients develop anemia usually in infancy.

Concepts.definition: An inherited condition characterized by aplasia of the erythroid series only. The white cells and platelets are not affected. Patients develop anemia usually in infancy.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Updated Short Name to be the Public ID per current conventions for VM Short Name. DW 10-03-2022

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A rare, autosomal recessive inherited disorder caused by mutation in the c-Mpl gene.  It is characterized by thrombocytopenia and absence of megakaryocytes.  It presents with bleeding in the first month of life.

Concepts.definition: A rare, autosomal recessive inherited disorder caused by mutation in the c-Mpl gene.  It is characterized by thrombocytopenia and absence of megakaryocytes.  It presents with bleeding in the first month of life.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Severe Congenital Neutropenia Type 1, Autosomal Dominant

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Severe Congenital Neutropenia Type 1, Autosomal Dominant
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Severe congenital neutropenia inherited in an autosomal dominant pattern and caused by mutation(s) in the ELANE gene, encoding neutrophil elastase

Concepts.longName: Severe Congenital Neutropenia Type 1, Autosomal Dominant
Concepts.definition: Severe congenital neutropenia inherited in an autosomal dominant pattern and caused by mutation(s) in the ELANE gene, encoding neutrophil elastase

PermissibleValues.value: Other inherited bone marrow failure syndrome

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Other Inherited Bone Marrow Failure Syndrome
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned._A group of inherited genetic hematopoietic stem cell disorders characterized by bone marrow failure that involves one or more cell lines. Representative examples include Fanconi anemia, Diamond-Blackfan anemia, and Shwachman-Diamond syndrome.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

A group of inherited genetic hematopoietic stem cell disorders characterized by bone marrow failure that involves one or more cell lines. Representative examples include Fanconi anemia, Diamond-Blackfan anemia, and Shwachman-Diamond syndrome.

PermissibleValues.value: Telomere Biology Disorders including Dyskeratosis congenita (DKC1, TERT, TERC, and other mutations)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A group of disorders caused by mutation(s) that disrupt the maintenance of telomeres, resulting in the short telomere defect.

Concepts.definition: A group of disorders caused by mutation(s) that disrupt the maintenance of telomeres, resulting in the short telomere defect.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An autosomal dominant condition caused by mutation(s) in the SAMD9 gene, encoding sterile alpha motif domain-containing protein 9A. It is a syndromic condition comprising myelodysplasia, infection, restriction of growth, adrenal hypoplasia, genital abnormalities, and enteropathy.

Concepts.definition: An autosomal dominant condition caused by mutation(s) in the SAMD9 gene, encoding sterile alpha motif domain-containing protein 9A. It is a syndromic condition comprising myelodysplasia, infection, restriction of growth, adrenal hypoplasia, genital abnormalities, and enteropathy.

PermissibleValues.value: Germline SAMD9L variant (SAMD9L-related Ataxia Pancytopenia Syndrome)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An autosomal dominant inherited syndrome caused by germline mutations of the SAMD9L gene. It is characterized by cerebellar ataxia, cytopenia in all cell lineages, and predisposition to myelodysplasia and myeloid leukemia.

Concepts.definition: An autosomal dominant inherited syndrome caused by germline mutations of the SAMD9L gene. It is characterized by cerebellar ataxia, cytopenia in all cell lineages, and predisposition to myelodysplasia and myeloid leukemia.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.
